etymology.description: semantic: 魚 ‘fish’ + abbreviated phonetic: 羴; alternatively ideogrammic: 魚 + 羊 ‘delicious’.
etymology.interpretation: Fish supplies the semantic field of food/seafood, while pronunciation follows 羴 (three-sheep), visually reduced to 羊 in the form. Pairing fish and sheep also evokes tasty, fresh fare, which extended to vivid colors; under a different reading it developed the sense ‘rare’.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by replacing 魚 with its simplified form 鱼; the rest of the structure remained unchanged.

examples.chinese: 今天的海鲜很新鲜，味道鲜美(今天的海鮮很新鮮，味道鮮美)。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān de hǎixiān hěn xīnxiān, wèidào xiānměi.
examples.english: Today's seafood is very fresh, and the taste is delicious.

examples.chinese: 这条裙子的颜色很鲜艳(這條裙子的顏色很鮮豔)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tiáo qúnzi de yánsè hěn xiānyàn.
examples.english: The color of this dress is very bright.

examples.chinese: 这种错误在正式文件里很鲜见(這種錯誤在正式文件裡很鮮見)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng cuòwù zài zhèngshì wénjiàn lǐ hěn xiǎnjiàn.
examples.english: Such errors are rare in formal documents.
